intro: Lactuca campestris, commonly known as Italian endive, is a leafy vegetable belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its curly, dark green leaves that are often used in salads or cooked dishes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and produces yellow flowers in the summer. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Lactuca campestris is cultivated for its edible leaves and is a popular crop in Mediterranean regions.
